Player History
Signed as a free agent by San Francisco on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1986, off Mark Eichhorn (TOR)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/21/1986, off Pete Vuckovich (OAK)...
Drove in 6 runs against Texas on 7/9/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/24/1987, hitting .414 with 4 HR, 10 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1987, hitting .371 with 10 HR, 32 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (Y) on 8/13/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/14/1987, hitting .750 with 5 HR, 16 RBI...
Won Batter of the Month award on 9/1/1987, hitting .489 with 12 HR, 39 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/18/1987, hitting .550 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $5,007,143 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 6/23/1988 with a Inflamed Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 4 weeks...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $5,007,143 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Detroit to Atlanta on 4/26/1989 (Going to ATL: C Matt Nokes, 1B Will Clark. Going to DET: P Tom Glavine, P Chris Hammond, C Jerry Willard, LF Glenn Wilson, 1B Larry Sheets)...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/8/1989, hitting .526 with 3 HR, 7 RBI...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Philadelphia on 8/25/1989...
Drove in 6 runs against Philadelphia on 8/26/1989...
Won Gold Glove Award at First Base in 1989...
2/2/1990: Gets a new one-year contract worth $5,007,143 through salary arbitration...
6/16/1990: Signed a contract extension with Atlanta, $8,000,000 per year, for 5 years.
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Montreal on 6/23/1990...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Won Player of the Week award on 10/2/1990, hitting .550 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Won Gold Glove Award at First Base in 1990...
Was selected to the 1991 Allstar game...
Won Most Valuable Player Award in 1991, hitting .316 with 32 HR, 95 RBI...
